similar_project_experience.project_name: Nebraska Innovation Campus Master Plan Analysis
similar_project_experience.project_description: Civil Engineer. In 2010, Olsson began its partnership with UNL on the original master planning of the 249 acres Nebraska Innovation Campus. In 2016, Olsson revisited its analysis of the site and updated the master plan to reflect construction to date, alternate building layouts, revised cost estimates and phasing plans. Olsson has advised UNL and their development partners about potential growth and phasing options to maximize the use of the existing infrastructure and provided parking options for reasonable access to the various buildings. Olsson reviewed the existing master plan, developed an inventory of current infrastructure, identified logical building pad sites, and determined areas ready to be developed. The master plan provided a series of buildout phases that identified each building and associated parking facilities. Erin has been involved with the campus master plan analysis and development since 2014 and has been civil engineer of record for the development of new campus infrastructure and building site construction. Size: 160 Acres | Cost: $5,000 (fee)

similar_project_experience.project_name: Nebraska Innovation Campus Rise Building
similar_project_experience.project_description: Civil Engineer. Erin was the Civil Engineer of record for the Rise Building at Nebraska Innovation Campus, a three-story, mixed-use facility serving project partners at NIC. Construction of the Rise Building included site grading, extension of Transformation Drive public roadway infrastructure, site utility and landscape improvements. Olsson provided site topographic survey, final plat entitlements, permitting, geotechnical report, public roadway improvements, site civil design, construction documents and construction administration. Size: 75,000 SF | Cost: $75,000 (Design), $15.3M (Construction)

similar_project_experience.project_name: Nebraska Innovation Campus Central Renewable Energy System
similar_project_experience.project_description: Civil Engineer. Erin provided civil engineering design and construction administration phase services for the design of the Central Renewable Energy System (CRES) located on Nebraska Innovation Campus. The CRES utility plant is an award winning closed-loop thermal energy system that uses reclaimed, non-potable water from the adjacent Theresa Street wastewater plant. Olsson created a wastewater effluent pumping station and force mains to and from the heat exchange facility. Supply and return line loop piping is extended through Nebraska Innovation Campus and individual NIC buildings are connected to the closed loop system to transfer heat in and out of the buildings according to the season. Olsson provided site topographic survey, permitting, geotechnical report, site civil design, CRES infrastructure design, construction documents and construction administration. Size: 28M gal. per day / 1.8M SF of building floor area | Cost: $700,242 (Design), $15M (Construction)

similar_project_experience.project_name: Nebraska Innovation Campus Greenhouses
similar_project_experience.project_description: Civil Engineer. Erin was the Civil Engineer of record for the Greenhouse Innovation Center at Nebraska Innovation Campus, a 45,000 square feet greenhouse and headhouse research facility. The Greenhouse Innovation Center is heated and cooled by alternative energy from the CRES utility plant on campus. Construction of the Rise Building included site grading, extension of CRES utility infrastructure, site paving, site utility and landscape improvements. Olsson provided site topographic survey, final plat entitlements, permitting, geotechnical report, public roadway improvements, site civil design, construction documents and construction administration. Size: 45,000 SF | Cost: $34,300 (Design), $9M (Construction)

similar_project_experience.project_name: College of Business
similar_project_experience.project_description: Civil Engineer. Erin was the Civil Engineer of record for the College of Business, an academic building on University of Nebraska-Lincoln City Campus. The project site was a challenging location within the built campus environment at the busy intersection of 14th and Vine Street. Construction of the College of Business included site demolition, grading and erosion control, public paving improvements, site paving and sidewalk, site utility and landscape improvements. Olsson provided site topographic survey, geotechnical report, public roadway improvements, site civil design, construction documents and construction administration. Size: 200,000 SF | Cost: $15,600 (Design), $80M (Construction)
